title: Replaced Pixel 3 still Overheating
content:
My original Pixel 3 was badly overheating so as per the initial Google support, I sent it back and received a refurbished one under Google warranty. The replacement had arrived on this Monday and I started using it since Monday evening. I have not installed 40% apps I used to have on my previous phone and I have tried the manuals the customer service agent provided. But it still overheats constantly and it gets worse while charging. 

I tried to contact the customer service via live chat as I used to but somehow it became u available.

Please advise options?

Will I receive another refurbished replacement? Or is it possible to get a new one? Is there an option to potentially upgrade to newer versions with extra charge, which I would not mind paying if suitable?

Look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards
Sol
